title: Mzwandile Stick
text:
Mzwandile Wanky Stick (born 5 October 1984 in Port Elizabeth) is a South African former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer, and currently the backline <a href="Coach%20%28sports%29">coach</a> for the <a href="South%20African%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South African national rugby union team</a>.
Playing career.
He captained the South Africa <a href="Rugby%20sevens%23Rugby%20union%20sevens">sevens</a> team during the <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20IRB%20Sevens%20World%20Series">2008–09 IRB Sevens World Series</a>, which saw the team win the series title for the first time. His favoured position was full-back. He came off the bench for a <a href="Southern%20Kings">Southern Kings</a> XV against <a href="British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions">British & Irish Lions</a> during the <a href="2009%20British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions%20tour%20to%20South%20Africa">2009 tour to South Africa</a>.
He was named in the wider training squad for the <a href="2013%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2013 Super Rugby season</a>, but was subsequently released to the Vodacom Cup squad.
Coaching.
He was named the Under-21 Assistant Coach in 2013. He became the head coach of the team and their <a href="Vodacom%20Cup">Vodacom Cup</a> team for 2014 and 2015, guiding the Under-19s to their first ever Under-19 Provincial Championship title in <a href="2015%20Under-19%20Provincial%20Championship%20Group%20A">2015</a>.
In December 2015, he was appointed as the backline coach of the <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> team for the <a href="2016%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2016 Super Rugby season</a>,
and joined the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa national rugby union team</a> in the same capacity in April 2016.
